Top-3 Scripts:
so_64882922: folder="folderX"
find "$folder" -type f -exec cp '{}' '{}'.bak \; -exec mv '{}'.bak "$folder" \;

so_44681057: find /<fullpath>/[primary]  -type d -name "[xyz_out]" | while     read f
do
     path=$(dirname "$f" | sed -re 's/[primary](\/)?/[secondary] \1/')
     echo "$f -> $path"
     mkdir -p "$path"
     mv "$f" "$path"
done`

find /<fullpath>[primary]  -type f -name "*.pdf"  | while read f
do
     path=$(dirname "$f" | sed -re 's/[primary](\/)?/[secondary] \1/')
     echo "$f -> $path"
     mkdir -p "$path"
     mv "$f" "$path"
done

Explanations about Options.-name:
This option is supported, but POSIX conformance depends on the POSIX conformance of
 the system's fnmatch(3) library function. As of findutils-4.2.2, shell
 metacharacters (`*', `?' or `[]' for example) will match a leading `.', because
 IEEE PASC interpretation 126 requires this. This is a change from previous
 versions of findutils.

Top-3 Scripts:
so_55832471: for file in *.mp4 ; do
    date=$(echo $file | cut -d'_' -f1)
    year=$(echo $date | cut -d'-' -f1)
    month=$(echo $date | cut -d'-' -f2)
    day=$(echo $date | cut -d'-' -f3)
    mkdir -p $year/$month/$day
    mv $file $year/$month/$day/
done
